lines: ﻿Mango felt sorry for them. Poor fellows! Unprotestingly they had stood in the same place since birth, subject to the sun, rain and wind, wasting their entire life.
"I must arouse them. They must not have such limited horizons, they must see new places and roam about till they have seen the world. Only then will they be really happy.
"Men keep the best land for themselves, chop us down with their axes, build their houses with our limbs, and set fire to our settlements."
"We won't stand for it any longer. We trees must unite. We must fight against Man's cruelty. We must destroy his houses and invade the lands he has seized from us."

Mango had watched the meetings human beings held in the village. He had listened to their speeches. Their leaders were noisy and spoke loudly. He decided to follow their example. Mango resolved to be the leader of the trees.
Mango was well placed at the top of the hill. He thought he should make a speech, but he first wanted a sip of water.
